title: 亞利桑那州現示威 有人持槍包圍點票中心

replies.msg:
美國總統大選開票進度持續停滯，亞利桑那州仍有60萬票尚未開出，數十名特朗普的支持者聚集在鳳凰城的點票中心示威。

網上早前傳出消息，指亞利桑那州馬里科帕縣有部分支持特朗普的選民，投票時使用油性箱頭筆（Sharpie marker）填寫選票，令讀票機讀取不到選票，而未有將相關選票點算在內。有大量特朗普支持者於4日晚間聚集在亞利桑那州的計票中心外，高喊著「停止偷竊（選舉）」、「計算我的選票！」等口號，其中部分抗議者還攜帶步槍與手槍到場。

據美聯社報道，亞利桑那州一位40歲居民麥克（Chris Michael）表示，來到這裡是為了確保所有選票都能被確實清點，希望計票工作能合乎道德與法律。在鳳凰城，有抗議者穿著印有支持特朗普的裝束，在馬里科帕縣選舉中心的停車場佔據。有示威者高呼，成員高呼：「霍士新聞糟透了！」，抗議該媒體率先拜登在亞利桑那州獲勝。

馬里科帕縣選舉部發言人梅根．吉爾伯特森（Megan Gilbertson）表示，計票工作將一直持續到深夜。兩名縣高級官員（一名是民主黨人，另一名是共和黨人）發表了一項聲明，對有關選舉過程的不實信息如何散播表示關注。

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/nov/04/facebook-posts/voting-machines-dont-read-ballots-filled-sharpies-/

It turns out the Maricopa County Elections Department was prescient about what some are calling Sharpie-gate.

On Oct. 24, the elections department posted on YouTube a video labeled: "Can I use a Sharpie on my Ballot? Maricopa County Voters can use a Sharpie to Mark their Ballot." By Nov. 4, it had more than 1,000 views.

An animated figure named Phil the Ballot introduces the video. The narrator says:

"Did you know you can use a black or blue pen or Sharpie to fill out your ballot in Maricopa County? The new tabulation equipment only reads the oval, so bleed-throughs are not a problem….

"At the vote center, you may notice fine-tip Sharpies are used. That’s because it’s the fastest-drying ink and works best on the tabulation equipment. If you’re filling out your ballot at home, you can use blue or black ink with ball-point pen or Sharpie. Just don’t use red ink. The tabulation equipment cannot read red."

In other words, the Sharpie is actually the preferred pen for filling out ballots in Maricopa County.
